snippet: Robert S. Ford, who resigned in February, said more weapons to the moderate Syrian rebels would increase the opposition’s leverage in peace talks and combat the rise of extremist groups.
abstract: Robert S Ford, former senior United States envoy to Syria, urges US and its allies to step up the supply of arms to moderate Syrian rebels; argues that move would increase the leverage of moderates in potential peace talks and help combat the rise of extremists.
lead_paragraph: Robert S. Ford, who resigned in February, said more weapons to the moderate Syrian rebels would increase the opposition’s leverage in peace talks and combat the rise of extremist groups.
